title: How to Cook Raspberry and White Chocolate Mille Feuille

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius (180 degrees Celsius fan forced).
Brushing each sheet with butter, layer the filo on a flat surface to make a stack.
Cut the stack length-wise into 3 equal strips.
Cut each strip crosswise into 4 rectangles.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until crisp or golden.
Use an electric mixer to beat the cream and icing sugar in a large bowl until soft peaks form.
Place 1 filo rectangle on a serving plate.
steps.description: Top with an 1/8 of the cream and raspberries.

steps.headline: Repeat the layers.
steps.description: Top it off with a third rectangle.

steps.headline: Drizzle the stacks with chocolate and dust with icing sugar.

text: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius (180 degrees Celsius fan forced).  Lightly grease 2 baking trays.  Brushing each sheet with butter, layer the filo on a flat surface to make a stack.  Cut the stack length-wise into 3 equal strips.  Cut each strip crosswise into 4 rectangles. You will have 12 in all. Place on prepared pre-greased trays.  Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until crisp or golden.  Set aside to cool.  Use an electric mixer to beat the cream and icing sugar in a large bowl until soft peaks form.  Place 1 filo rectangle on a serving plate. Top with an 1/8 of the cream and raspberries. Repeat the layers. Top it off with a third rectangle. Drizzle the stacks with chocolate and dust with icing sugar.
